title: Psychiana, A Mail Order Religion Created in the Small Town of Moscow, Idaho
creator: Northwest Public Broadcasting
description: Short video describing Psychiana, a mail order religion that preached the New Thought Movement. In 1928, Dr. Frank B. Robinson created Psychiana in Moscow, Idaho.
subject: Religion; Frank B. Robinson
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. title: Good News - Radio program 1
creator: The Izzard Company
description: This radio program corresponds with the transcript of Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 3. Episode begins proclaiming the growth of Pyschiana and then takes listeners to Robinson's home in Moscow, Idaho, describing its appearance. A dialogue begins between a 'guide' and Robinson about miracles, healing, the God-Law, the mail Robinson receives, and the 'Life Impulse' or 'motivating spirit' that allows people to think and live with God.
subject: God-Law; Life Spirit; Mircales; Healing; Sudent Letters; Testimonials
publisher-digital: University of Idaho Library Digital Initiatives, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/
source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

title: Good News - Man's Quest
creator: The Izzard Company
description: This radio program episode discusses man's quest for answers, then introduces Robinson and his concept of the Cosmic God-Power. Robinson discusses the God-Power, reads a student letter asking for help, and uses the discovery of the 'cosmic ray' by Professor Milikan as evidence that there is invisible power around us. Robinson claims this Power is for our use and can bring anyone what they desire. Also includes a testimonial from a man claimed to live in Holland.
subject: Spirit of God, God-Power;  Cosmic Rays; Science and Technology; Student Letters; Hardship; Material Abundance; Testimonials
publisher-digital: University of Idaho Library Digital Initiatives, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/
